# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/gopher/parser/Parser.java
#	src/main/java/gopher/task/TaskList.java
#	src/main/java/gopher/ui/UI.java

Resolve: Keep branch-Level-9 changes but adjust the layout for the javadoc

Apply Variable Arguments to allow deleting multiple tasks simultaneously
Apply Variable Arguments to allow marking multiple tasks as done
Apply Variable Arguments to allow marking multiple tasks as not done

Merge branch 'branch-A-Varargs'
Change build name from gopher to Gopher
Parser.java: Enhance code quality
commitResults.messageBody:
The parseCreateTaskCommand is too long and hard to understand.
Some constants are named incorrectly using camel cases.

Use extract method refactoring to shorten method and
change the constant names to SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE

Such approach improves code quality because it provides higher level of
abstractions which makes the code a lot easier to read and maintain.
Also, using SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE makes it easier to identify constants

Improve on existing Javadoc and add more comments for clarity

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: TaskManager and Parser
commitResults.messageBody:
The current TaskManager contains logic of interpreting saved task string
which should be inside Parser instead

Shift this part of the logic to Parser to improve organization of code

Some minor adjustments:
* Change constant name from camelCase to SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE
* Rename some methods for better clarity as the existing ones can result
in confusion

commitResults.messageTitle: TaskList.java: Update comments
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskList no longer directly prints out messages on UI after introducing
GUI in Level-10 increment, but the comments are not updated

These comments are now removed for better clarity of the program

Some comments that briefly explains on the reason of code implementation
are added for clarity as well

commitResults.messageTitle: Parser.java: Change the name and implementation of isInvalidTaskType()
commitResults.messageBody:
isInvalidTaskType may result in double negation in the future if we
want to use the method to check if a task type is valid, which may
result in less readable code.

Hence, the function name and implementation is negated to make
everything more straightforward and easier to understand

commitResults.messageTitle: Gopher.java: Refactor the getResponse() method
commitResults.messageBody:
The method body of getResponse() method is too long and consists of many
low level implementation that would make the code very hard to read.

Use extract method refactoring to isolate out the logics to enhance
readability of the code.

Other minor changes:
* Adhere to coding standard and move task creation logic outside of the
else block, and replace it with error handling logic
* Pass the UnknownCommandException to GUI instead because the error is
now thrown by getResponse Method if execution reaches default branch and
it must be handled externally instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: Parser.java: Fix minor typos
commitResults.messageBody:
Change the task type in MissingTokenException to lower case instead to
make it consistent with other error messages

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'master' into branch-A-Streams
TaskList.java: Implement Stream
commitResults.messageBody:
The current implementation of find method is not very straightforward
because it involves a lot of logics like Regex pattern and Matcher which
makes the code looks messy.

Change the iterative implementation to stream as it offers a more
straightforward pipeline in filtering out the desired tasks that matches
the given pattern. Hence improves the readability of the code

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #3 from MAOXIONGKAI/branch-A-Streams
commitResults.messageBody: Branch a streams

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement basic update task feature to fulfill C-Update extension
commitResults.messageBody:
User can now use update [task number] taskName [tokens] field value to
specify the fields within the task that they want to update.

For example: update 4 Hello /by 2024-05-11 changes the 4-th task's name
in the task list to Hello. If the task is Deadline, then change its
due date to May 11 2024, else a warning message will be prompted by
gopher

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error handling to prevent user from updating task with wrong command
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently user can include tokens that are not recognized by the task
type as part of the task name, which is not a very good way of handling
updating logic because including token as part of the name leads to
more confusion and can make the app hard to use if user is careless

Hence, checks are added to the update logic of each type of task to
raise error message to the user when they accidentally type in invalid
tokens when updating a task. By reinforcing this we can make the whole
task management app cleaner and less error-prone

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: shift the parsing of update command logic into Parser.java
commitResults.messageBody:
The current parsing logic is in individual task type's update method,
which makes the code very messy and hard to organize.

Hence, the parsing logic are shifted to Parser.java to make the code
more readable and adhere to code quality and standards

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #5 from MAOXIONGKAI/branch-C-Update
commitResults.messageBody: Branch c update

commitResults.messageTitle: Apply another style for gopher warning messages to make UI more unique
commitResults.messageBody:
The warning messages from gopher is of the same style as other messages,
this makes it quite hard for user to identify whether his/her inputs
are correctly accepted by gopher

Therefore, some checks are implemented to render the gopher dialog box
with red gradient background instead to make sure that it stands out
among other messages, hence improving overall user experience.

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated some error messages so that they get styled correctly on GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
The current warning message styling only applies to message with text
"Please try again" inside, but some of the current error messages from
gopher do not contain this piece of text, hence they are not styled
as expected

Since "Please try again" should be something exclusive to warning
messages only, it should be acceptable to reinforce all error messages
to contain this piece of text. Therefore, those problematic error
messages are fixed by including this piece of text to make sure that
they are styled correctly on the GUI

commitResults.messageTitle: Adjust the size of the profile images for both user and gopher
commitResults.messageBody:
The current profile images are unnecessarily big, because the users and
the chatbot are fixed characters in the application, this results in a
lot of valuable spaces in the window wasted.

Hence, the profile images are reduced in size to give more space to the
text and other UI elements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow resizing of application window
commitResults.messageBody:
The layout of the program window is messed up when user attempts to
resize the window.

Changes are made by SceneBuilder configurations to ensure that the
window and the UI elements are anchored properly at the expected
position when user resize the window, so as to enhance user experience

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-BetterGui'
Update messages to give Gopher a unique personality
commitResults.messageBody:
The current messages sent by gopher makes him sounds like a robot, which
makes the application quite monotonous, this may reduce user experience
because the interactions are not very entertaining

Hence, some of the messages are rewritten to make sure that Gopher's
messages are more friendly to the user, so as to enhance overall user
experience

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-Personality'
Add error handling when input command has missing or invalid task number
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, some of the task command such as mark/unmark, delete, update
does not handle situations when user pass in commands with missing or
invalid task number, such as "delete" or "update hello /by 2024-09-17",
and only an empty message will be shown when such error happens. Even
though this is not crashing the application, it is reducing the user
experience when commands are not input properly.

Therefore, MissingTaskNumberException has been added to handle situation
like this, and when the error is caught by gopher, gopher will warn user
about the missing/invalid number in the given command, hence improving
user experience

commitResults.messageTitle: Change how MissingTaskNameException is thrown for update feature
commitResults.messageBody:
The current implementation of update does not give error warning in
correct logical order(For example, when inputting "update", user is
prompted with don't know how to update instead of don't know which task
to update), this can lead to confusion of user.

Therefore, the logic of throwing the exception is reorganized such that
everything appears in the correct way, improving overall user experience
when using this feature

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error handling when user inputs task number that does not point to any valid task in the task list
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the system would break if user enters a task number that
does not point to any valid task in the task list, this would render the
system useless if user are perform operations on multiple tasks at the
same time, hence compromising user experience.

Hence, InvalidTaskNumberException is introduced to make sure that user
gets notified correctly on the task number that causes such issues, such
that they can easily change their command to carry out desired actions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement save and load API for taskList Object
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently save and load task are handled by the Task Manager Object,
which requires reference of the ArrayList of tasks inside the TaskList
Object to work correctly. Such implementation is very inflexible as
TaskList object is only accessible within the Gopher class but its
ArrayList of task cannot be accessed due to encapsulation.

Therefore, save and load task API are implemented within TaskList class
as an application of the Tell, Don't Ask Principle to ensure that Gopher
class can get access to save and load feature for its own task list
without having to break the abstraction barrier.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix the issue of tasks statuses not updated when InvalidTaskNumberException is thrown.
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, task statuses will not get updated correctly because of
premature return of the functions due to InvalidTaskNumberException,
this makes it very hard for user to keep track of the actual status
of the task list, hence rendering the system useless.

Therefore, finally blocks are added to execute the taskList save API
to ensure that task statuses are always saved regardless of whether
an exception is thrown during the program execution.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix the issue of Gopher congratulating user when no matched task found
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, gopher will display a message congratulating user for not
having pending task when there's no task that appear on the search
result. This message is misleading and should not be there when find
method is executed.

Hence, this message has been extract to UI class and would only appear
when list task method is called and not when the find task method is
called. This ensures that the gopher's message to the user is always
accurate

commitResults.messageTitle: Extend InvalidTokenException check to task creation feature
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, user can create task with certain token names if these tokens
are not recognized by the respective task creation command. This may
lead to confusion of user when viewing the task list content.

Therefore, the InvalidTokenException check is extended to all types of
task creation command to ensure that user will be warned that they can't
use tokens for other tasks as part of the task name, hence improving the
overall user experience.

commitResults.messageTitle: Extend InvalidTokenException check to task creation feature
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, user can create task with certain token names if these tokens
are not recognized by the respective task creation command. This may
lead to confusion of user when viewing the task list content.

Therefore, the InvalidTokenException check is extended to all types of
task creation command to ensure that user will be warned that they can't
use tokens for other tasks as part of the task name, hence improving the
overall user experience.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-MoreErrorHandling'
Fix the issue of task list delete feature removing the wrong task
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently the delete feature in task list will remove the first n tasks
if user provides n task numbers, which is not correct. It is found that
the retrieving of task from the list is not working properly because the
tasks are accessed using loop control variable i instead of the supplied
task numbers.

Hence, the delete function is changed to ensure that it accesses the
correct tasks based on the given task numbers instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: Extract out the logic of checking Gopher message type to Message.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, Gopher's response will be styled as red background if the
response is a warning message that contains text "Please try again".
Even though such implementation works in most cases, it will introduce
styling error in the system if user creates a task with "Please try
again" as part of its name, hence affecting user experience. Also, such
way of recognizing message type and styling is not very extensible and
flexible, hence a better idea would be extract out the logic to another
class to explicitly handle this, so as to provide more flexibility when
similar features need to be developed in the future.

As a result, Message class is created to wrap around the text returned
by Gopher so that other information such as message type can be input
and pass around the program for checks. This offers more flexibility as
compared to the initial approach and hence should be included in the
latest update

commitResults.messageTitle: Add logic to handle FileCorruptedException
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, Gopher does not give any explicit message to user when the
file is corrupted or missing, this can render the app useless if the
user does not know how to fix the issue himself/herself.

Therefore, checks and warning messages are added to make sure that user
can be aware of the file corruption issue when performing operators that
relies on save files and storage, so as to improve overall user
experience

commitResults.messageTitle: Shortened messages for multiple task operation command
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently when multiple tasks are manipulated by one single command,
such as mark, unmark and update, the title of the message will be printed
for each task, which makes the whole message looked very messy and hard
to read.

Modify the logic of creating messages for those commands such that the
title only appears for once per operation instead of per task.

Fix minor style and content issues in user guide
Fix the issue of valid duration being treated as invalid
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, if user updates an event task with new valid start and end
date, but the new start date is after the current end date, Gopher will
complain that the user has given an invalid date duration, which is not
correct. This is because Gopher only checks whether the start date is
before the current end date or not, and not checking whether it is
before the new end date.

Hence, extra logic is added to determine the new start and end date
before the actual comparison to make sure that Gopher will always
analyze the given duration correctly.
